meanings.definition: Excessively compensating for a perceived weakness or deficiency.
meanings.sent1: Her overcompensatory behavior made her stand out in the group.
meanings.sent2: His overcompensatory actions were a result of his insecurity.
meanings.sent3: The overcompensatory clown kept tripping over his own shoes, trying to be funny.
meanings.sent4: The overcompensatory display of wealth only highlighted his inner struggles.
meanings.sent5: The overcompensatory apology was so elaborate that it seemed insincere.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an attempt to make up for a lack or loss by excessive effort.
meanings.sent1: The overcompensatory student studied all night for the exam.
meanings.sent2: Her overcompensatory gestures were appreciated by her friends.
meanings.sent3: The overcompensatory chef added too many spices to the dish, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: His overcompensatory need for attention led to exaggerated stories about his adventures.
meanings.sent5: The overcompensatory workout left him exhausted but satisfied with his progress.
